intro: Marrubium sewerzovii, commonly known as the Caucasian hawksbeard, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Marrubium sewerzovii is valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for respiratory and digestive ailments.
